page.title: 08The Butterfly farm
page.content: We went to the Butterfly Farm in the parish of St.Mary's. The Butterfly Farm was opened 6 years ago. They get around 800 visitors a day, 99% are tourists and 1% are locals. The biggest butterfly that they've got is the Owl Butterfly which has a wing span of 8 inches. The rarest butterfly is the large tortoiseshell which is a British butterfly which is nearly extinct because it fed on elm trees and because of Dutch elm disease many of them have died. The average temperature is 80 degrees farenheit. The difference between butterflies and moths is that butterflies antennae are long and slender with clubbed ends, moths antennae are tapered at the end or feathered. The farm has bred Comet Moths, the largest moth in the world. It has never been bred in captivity before.
